title: Mike Vrabel on the AFC Championship game, Kayshon Boutte, and responding to Ty Law’s claims
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Patriots Vrabel also discussed his players being motivated by ESPN predictions, Will Campbell, and the role that winter weather played against the Texans.
Mike Vrabel following the Patriots' playoff win over the Texans on Jan.

title: Ann Michael Maye wears fan favorite sweatshirt for Patriots win over Texans
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots The "I [Heart] Drake Maye" shirts have taken over the Boston sports sphere over the last few months.
Ann Michael Maye work a "I [Heart] Drake Maye" hoodie on Sunday.

Annmichaelmaye / TikTok By Conor Ryan January 19, 2026 | 8:01 AM 2 minutes to read FOXBOROUGH — If you’ve been to Gillette Stadium, TD Garden, or just about any sports bar in New England over the last few months, odds are that you’ve seen the “I [Heart] Drake Maye” shirts.

title: Kayshon Boutte’s highlight-reel catch vs. Texans was déjà vu for Drake Maye
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "He continues to show up, game in and game out.
" Kayshon Boutte gave the Patriots some breathing room with a clutch catch in the fourth quarter.
(AP Photo/Steven Senne) By Conor Ryan January 19, 2026 | 7:54 AM 4 minutes to read FOXBOROUGH — Kayshon Boutte wasn’t lacking in terms of confidence earlier this week.

title: What Mike Vrabel said about another up-and-down playoff performance from Drake Maye
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots Maye had three touchdowns, including a highlight-reel throw to Kayshon Boutte.
He also had four fumbles and three turnovers.
Drake Maye AP Photo/Robert F.

title: With a Super Bowl berth within sight, Patriots aren’t playing with ‘house money’ anymore
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots A win next Sunday against a banged-up Broncos team would punch New England's ticket to Super Bowl LX.
Drake Maye and the Patriots have a chance to go to the Super Bowl next week with a win in Denver.
(AP Photo/Robert F.

title: ‘I need to play better’: Will Campbell’s candid comments after Patriots’ playoff win vs. Texans
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Patriots "I hold myself to a higher standard than what I put out tonight.
" Will Campbell warming up prior to Patriots-Texans.

Photo by Adam Glanzman/Getty Images Amid the Patriots’ 28-16 divisional-round win over the Texans on Sunday, there were still a few players on the home team who were less than thrilled with their performance at Gillette Stadium.

title: Remember the Philly Special? Nick Foles is already trolling the Patriots ahead of AFC title game.
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots "A positive note going into the game versus the Patriots is that they struggle against backup QBs in championship-type games.

" Nick Foles AP Photo/Chris Carlson As soon as the clocks hit zero during the Patriots’ win over the Texans at Gillette Stadium on Sunday, the New England knew that it would be facing a top-seeded Broncos team that is suddenly missing its starting quarterback.
Denver’s Bo Nix broke his ankle on Saturday during the fourth quarter of their win against the Bills.

title: 4 things to know about Patriots’ AFC title game foe Broncos
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots The Patriots won't have to game plan for Bo Nix next week, as the Broncos quarterback is out for the season.
Bo Nix will not play next Sunday against the Patriots are breaking a bone in his ankle this weekend.

(AP Photo/Bart Young) FOXBOROUGH — It wasn’t pretty at times, but a dominant defensive showing from the Patriots helped New England overcome the Texans 28-16 on Sunday and punch their ticket to the AFC Championship game for the first time since the 2019 season.

title: The Patriots defense heard the hype about the Texans defense. They used it as fuel and stole the show.
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots "Ain’t nobody been talking about our defense all year.
We’ll see what they’ve got to say today.
" Jaylinn Hawkins and the Patriots defense had a lot to celebrate on Sunday Barry Chin/Globe Staff ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Cardi B, Patriots troll ESPN after New England defied expert predictions in playoff win
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Patriots "Oh no.
" Patriots flags carried onto the field during the divsional-round playoff win vs.
the Texans.
